sen.j: ビッグひな祭り（ビッグひなまつり）は、徳島県勝浦町（旧阿波国）、千葉県勝浦市（旧上総国）及び長野県須坂市（旧信濃国）において、毎年2月から3月（須坂では3月から4月）に開催されている雛祭りである。
sen.e: Big Hinamatsuri (Big Doll Festival) is Hinamatsuri (Doll's Festival) held in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture (former Awa Province), Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture (former Kazusa Province), and Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture (former Shinano Province) during February and March (during March and April in Suzaka City) every year.

Big Hinamatsuri (Big Doll Festival) is a Hinamatsuri (Doll's Festival) held in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture (former Awa Province), Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture (former Kazusa Province), and Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture (former Shinano Province) during February and March (during March and April in Suzaka City) every year.

Big Hinamatsuri is a Hinamatsuri (Doll's Festival) held in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture (former Awa Province), Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture (former Kazusa Province), and Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture (former Shinano Province) during February and March (during March and April in Suzaka City) every year.
sen.cmt: ビッグひなまつり 補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 発祥は徳島県勝浦町あるが、のちにそれが派生する形で千葉県勝浦市、長野県須坂市においても開催されるようになった。
sen.e: It originated in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture, but later it came to be held also in Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture and Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture, as secondary to the original festival.
sen.cmt: 「勝浦町あるが」→「勝浦町であるが」だと判断しました。
sen.e: It originated in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture, but later it came to be held also in Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture and Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture, as secondary to the original festival.
It originated in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture, but later it came to be held also in Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture and Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture, as secondary to the original festival.

sen.j: 期間中は、巨大な雛壇に無数のひな人形が飾られる。
sen.e: During the period of the festival, an enormous hinadan (a tired platform carpeted in red for traditional dolls) is decked with numerous hina dolls (traditional dolls).
During the period of the festival, an enormous hinadan (a tired platform carpeted in red for traditional dolls) is decked with numerous hina dolls (traditional dolls).
During the period of the festival, an enormous hinadan (a tiered platform carpeted in red for traditional dolls) is decked with numerous hina dolls (traditional dolls).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

tit.cmt: コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: - 徳島県勝浦町にて始まる
sen.e: - It started in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture.
- It started in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture.
It started in Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文頭のハイフンを削除しました。

tit.cmt: コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: - 千葉県勝浦市にて始まる
sen.e: - It started in Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture.
- It started in Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture.
It started in Katsuura City, Chiba Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文頭のハイフンを削除しました。

tit.cmt: コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: - 長野県須坂市にて始まる
sen.e: - It started in Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture.
- It started in Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture.
It started in Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文頭のハイフンを削除しました。

sen.j: 勝浦町生名の人形文化交流館において、ビッグひな祭り実行委員会及び特定非営利活動法人阿波勝浦井戸端塾によって約1ヶ月にわたり開催される。
sen.e: The festival is held for about one month by the Big Doll Festival Execution Committee and a specified nonprofit corporation called Awa Katsuura Idobata Juku at Ningyo Bunka Koryu Kaikan (Doll Cultural Exchange Hall) in Ikuna, Katsuura-cho.

The festival is held for about one month by the Big Doll Festival Execution Committee and a specified nonprofit corporation called Awa Katsuura Idobata Juku at Ningyo Bunka Koryu Kaikan (Doll Cultural Exchange Hall) in Ikuna, Katsuura-cho.

The festival is held for about one month by the Big Doll Festival Execution Committee and a specified nonprofit corporation called Awa Katsuura Idobata Juku at Ningyo Bunka Koryu Kaikan (Doll Cultural Exchange Hall) in Ikuna, Katsuura-cho.

sen.j: 会場では、2万体以上のひな人形が飾られ、なかでも高さ約7メートルの巨大な雛壇が目玉となっている。
sen.e: More than 2,000 hina dolls are displayed at the site, with a special feature of an enormous hinadan which is approximately seven meters high.
More than 2,000 hina dolls are displayed at the site, with a special feature of an enormous hinadan which is approximately seven meters high.
More than 20,000 hina dolls are displayed at the site, with a special feature of an enormous hinadan which is approximately seven meters high.

sen.j: ひな人形は日本全国から寄せられたもので、供養料として5千円 (通貨)が必要である。
sen.e: The hina dolls have been received from all over Japan, and 5,000 yen (currency) is required as a memorial service fee for the dead.
The hina dolls have been received from all over Japan, and 5,000 yen (currency) is required as a memorial service fee for the dead.
The hina dolls have been received from all over Japan, and 5,000 yen (currency) is required as a memorial service for beloved but now unwanted old hina dolls.
sen.cmt: 供養→人形供養の意味と解釈し、memorial service for beloved but now unwanted old hina dolls としました。（参考：http://photojapan.karigrohn.com/ningyo%20kuyo/ningyokuyo.htm）

sen.j: 公共交通機関利用の場合
sen.e: Via public transportation
Via public transportation
Via public transportation

sen.j: 四国旅客鉄道徳島駅より徳島バス（勝浦線）乗車で約1時間（会場付近にバス停留所有り）
sen.e: Approximately one hour (there is a bus stop near the site) from Tokushima Station, Shikoku Railway Company (JR Shikoku), via Tokushima Bus (Katsuura Route)
Approximately one hour (there is a bus stop near the site) from Tokushima Station, Shikoku Railway Company (JR Shikoku), via Tokushima Bus (Katsuura Route)
Approximately one hour (there is a bus stop near the site) from Tokushima Station, Shikoku Railway Company (JR Shikoku), via Tokushima Bus (Katsuura Route)

sen.j: 自家用自動車利用の場合
sen.e: Via private car
Via private car
Via private car

sen.j: 鳴門インターチェンジより国道11号・国道55号・徳島県道16号徳島上那賀線経由で約30キロメートル（会場付近に駐車場有り）
sen.e: Approximately 30 km (there is a parking area near the site) from Naruto Interchange via Tokushima-Kaminaka Route using National Route 11, National Route 55, and Tokushima Prefectural Road 16
Approximately 30 km (there is a parking area near the site) from Naruto Interchange via Tokushima-Kaminaka Route using National Route 11, National Route 55, and Tokushima Prefectural Road 16
Approximately 30 km (there is a parking area near the site) from Naruto Interchange via Tokushima-Kaminaka Route using National Route 11, National Route 55, and Tokushima Prefectural Road 16

sen.j: 勝浦市内の各地において、ビッグひな祭り実行委員会によって約2週間にわたり開催される。
sen.e: It is held for about two weeks by the Big Doll Festival Execution Committee in various places in Katsuura City.
It is held for about two weeks by the Big Doll Festival Execution Committee in various places in Katsuura City.
It is held for about two weeks by the Big Doll Festival Execution Committee in various places in Katsuura City.

sen.j: 徳島県勝浦町より譲り受けた7千体を含む計3万体以上のひな人形が飾られる。
sen.e: A total of more than 30,000 hina dolls are displayed, including 7,000 dolls that were given from Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture.
A total of more than 30,000 hina dolls are displayed, including 7,000 dolls that were donated by Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture.
A total of more than 30,000 hina dolls are displayed, including 7,000 dolls that were donated by Katsuura-cho, Tokushima Prefecture.
sen.cmt: イタリックになっていた箇所を変更しました。

sen.j: 期間中は市役所や東日本旅客鉄道勝浦駅等の公共施設、商店街の各店舗などにひな壇が設置され、遠見岬神社では参道の石階段60段に約1,200体のひな人形が飾られる。
sen.e: Hinadan is set up in various stores in community facilities and local shopping areas such as city hall and Katsuura Station of the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) during the period; approximately 1,200 hina dolls are displayed on the 60 stone steps of sando (an approach to the temple) of Tomisaki-jinja Shrine.

Hinadan is set up in various stores in community facilities and local shopping areas such as city hall and Katsuura Station of the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) during the period; approximately 1,200 hina dolls are displayed on the 60 stone steps of sando (an approach to the temple) of Tomisaki-jinja Shrine.

Hinadan is set up in various stores in community facilities and local shopping areas such as city hall and Katsuura Station of the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) during the period; approximately 1,200 hina dolls are displayed on the 60 stone steps of sando (an approach) of Tomisaki-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 神社への参道ですのでtemple を削除し、an approachのみとしました。

sen.j: また、例年パッケージツアーが組まれる他、土曜日及び日曜日には臨時特急列車「かううらひなまつり号」が運行されるなどで、賑わいを見せている。
sen.e: Furthermore, in addition to the packaged tours which are arranged annually, other attractions such as an extra express train called ''Katsuura Hinamatsuri Go'' being run on Saturdays and Sundays attract large crowds.
sen.cmt: 「かううらひなまつり号」→「かつうらひなまつり号」だと判断しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, in addition to the packaged tours which are arranged annually, other attractions such as an extra express train called ''Katsuura Hinamatsuri Go'' being run on Saturdays and Sundays attract large crowds.

Furthermore, in addition to the packaged tours which are arranged annually, other attractions such as an extra express train called 'Katsuura Hinamatsuri Go' being run on Saturdays and Sundays attract large crowds.

sen.j: 勝浦商店街では歩行者天国やパレード、開催期間の最後の土曜日及び日曜日にはJR東日本主催の「勝浦ひなまつりハイキング」などのイベントも行われる。
sen.e: In Katsuura Shopping Street, streets become pedestrian paradise and a parade is held, and events which take place include "Katsuura Hinamatsuri Hiking" organized by JR East on the last Saturday and Sunday during the period.

In Katsuura Shopping Street, streets become pedestrian paradise and a parade is held, and events which take place include "Katsuura Hinamatsuri Hiking" organized by JR East on the last Saturday and Sunday during the period.

In Katsuura Shopping Street, streets become pedestrian paradise and a parade is held, and events which take place include 'Katsuura Hinamatsuri Hiking' organized by JR East on the last Saturday and Sunday during the period.

sen.j: 公共交通機関利用の場合

Via public transportation
Via public transportation

sen.j: JR外房線勝浦駅よりメイン会場まで徒歩10分（途中にも雛壇あり）
sen.e: Ten-minute walk to the main site (hinadan can also be found en route to the main site) from Katsuura Station, JR Sotobo Line.
Ten-minute walk to the main site (hinadan can also be found en route to the main site) from Katsuura Station, JR Sotobo Line.

sen.j: - 東京湾アクアライン-館山自動車道・木更津北インターチェンジ-国道409号-国道297号-国道128号-守谷海岸駐車場（誘導看板あり）
sen.e: Tokyo Bay Aqua Line - Tateyama Expressway, Kisarazu-Kita Interchange - National Route 409 - National Route 297 - National Route 128 - Moriya Beach Parking Area (there is a guidance sign)

sen.j: - 館山自動車道・市原インターチェンジ-国道297号-国道128号-守谷海岸駐車場（誘導看板あり）
sen.e: Tateyama Expressway, Ichihara Interchange - National Route 297 - National Route 128 - Moriya Beach Parking Area (there is a guidance sign)

sen.j: ※駐車場よりメイン会場までのシャトルバスあり
sen.e: * There is a shuttle bus from the parking area to the main site.

sen.j: 長野県須坂市
sen.e: Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture
Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture
Suzaka City, Nagano Prefecture

sen.j: 須坂市内の各地において、「須坂の町の雛祭り実行委員会」によって約1カ月（3月3日から4月3日）にわたり、開催される。
sen.e: The festival is held for approximately one month (from March 3 until April 3) in various places in Suzaka City by the ''Suzaka-no-Machi-no Doll Festival Execution Committee''.
The festival is held for approximately one month (from March 3 until April 3) in various places in Suzaka City by the ''Suzaka-no-Machi-no Doll Festival Execution Committee''.
The festival is held for approximately one month (from March 3 until April 3) in various places in Suzaka City by the 'Execution Committee for Doll Festival in Suzuka Town.'
sen.cmt: 須坂の町の雛祭り実行委員会→Execution Committee for Doll Festival in Suzuka Town としました。

sen.j: 古い町並みの残る須坂の町には古くから大切に受け継がれてきたお雛様があり、それらを多くの方に見ていただこうと始まった。
sen.e: The town of Suzuka City still has the scenery reminiscent of the old days, and it has hina dolls that have been treasured and passed down through the ages; the festival began with the intent to show the hina dolls to many people.

The town of Suzuka City still has the scenery reminiscent of the old days, and it has hina dolls that have been treasured and passed down through the ages; the festival began with the intent to show the hina dolls to many people.

The town of Suzaka City still has the scenery reminiscent of the old days, and it has hina dolls that have been treasured and passed down through the ages; the festival began with the intent to show the hina dolls to many people.

sen.j: 期間中は百数十箇所の商店や美術館、博物館にお雛様が展示され、ピンクののぼり旗が目印となる。
sen.e: Over the festival period, hina dolls are displayed in a hundred and several tens of shops, and in galleries and museums, and pink, vertically long banners serve as the landmark.
Over the festival period, hina dolls are displayed in a hundred and several tens of shops, and in galleries and museums, and pink, vertically long banners serve as a landmark.
Over the festival period, hina dolls are displayed in a hundred and several tens of shops, and in galleries and museums, and pink, vertically long banners serve as a landmark.
sen.cmt: イタリックになっていた箇所を変更しました。

sen.j: 歴史を感じさせる享保雛、草木染の段飾り雛人形、まゆ雛、土雛、木目込み五段飾りのお雛様、慶応から平成までの歴代段飾りのお雛様など、時代を超えて様々なお雛様が見られる。
sen.e: Various hina dolls throughout the ages are displayed, such as Kyoho-bina which has a historical air, a tiered-display of hina dolls of plant dyeing, Mayu-bina (made by painting a cocoon to make it look like hina doll), Tsuchi-bina (ceramic hina dolls), a five-tier display of wooden hina dolls with Japanese costumes made from cloth with the edges tucked into grooves in the wood, and a tiered-display of successive hina dolls from the Keio period until the Heisei period.

Various hina dolls throughout the ages are displayed, such as Kyoho-bina, which has a historical air, a tiered-display of hina dolls of plant dyeing, Mayu-bina (made by painting a cocoon to make it look like a hina doll), Tsuchi-bina (ceramic hina dolls), a five-tier display of wooden hina dolls with Japanese costumes made from cloth with the edges tucked into grooves in the wood, and a tiered-display of successive hina dolls from the Keio period until the Heisei period.

Various hina dolls throughout the ages are displayed, such as Kyoho-bina, which has a historical air, a tiered-display of hina dolls of plant dyeing, Mayu-bina (made by painting a cocoon to make it look like a hina doll), Tsuchi-bina (ceramic hina dolls), a five-tier display of wooden hina dolls with Japanese costumes made from cloth with the edges tucked into grooves in the wood, and a tiered-display of successive hina dolls from the Keio era until the Heisei period.
sen.cmt: 慶応→Keio era としました。

sen.j: なかでも「三十段飾り千体の雛祭り（1月31日～4月7日。世界の民族人形博物館）」と「田中本家博物館 雛の宴」は見逃せない。
sen.e: For example, ''Dolls' Festival with Thousand Hina Dolls on Thirty Tiers'' (January 31 - April 7, World Folk Doll Museum) and "Tanaka Honke Museum Feast of Hina Doll" are must-sees.
For example, ''Dolls' Festival with Thousand Hina Dolls on Thirty Tiers'' (January 31 - April 7, World Folk Doll Museum) and "Tanaka Honke Museum Feast of Hina Doll" are must-sees.
For example, 'Dolls' Festival with Thousand Hina Dolls on Thirty Tiers' (January 31 - April 7, World Folk Doll Museum) and 'Tanaka Honke Museum Feast of Hina Doll' are must-sees.

sen.j: 北信濃市町村との連携「ぶらり北信濃ひな巡り」や「十二単の結婚式」も実施される。
sen.e: Events called ''Burari Kitashinano Hina Tour'' and "Wedding with Juni-Hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono)'' are also conducted in cooperation with municipalities in northern Shinano Province.
Events called ''Burari Kitashinano Hina Tour'' and "Wedding with Juni-Hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono)'' are also conducted in cooperation with municipalities in northern Shinano Province.
Events called 'Burari Kitashinano Hina Tour' and 'Wedding with Juni-Hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono)' are also conducted in cooperation with municipalities in northern Shinano Province.

sen.j: 「十二単の結婚式」の新郎新婦は、全国から応募があった中から1組が選ばれる。
sen.e: For the bride and groom in the "Wedding with Juni-Hitoe", a pair is chosen from couples applying from all over Japan.
For the bride and groom in the "Wedding with Juni-Hitoe", a pair is chosen from couples applying from all over Japan.
For the bride and groom in the 'Wedding with Juni-Hitoe,' a pair is chosen from couples applying from all over Japan.

sen.j: ウオーキングのまち須坂では、雛祭りに協賛して「ＪＲ東日本 駅からハイキング」及び「信州須坂・シルクと蔵のまちツーデーウオーキング」も行われる。
sen.e: As Suzaka City is known for walking, events such as ''JR East Hiking from the Station'' and "Shinshu Suzaka: A Two-Day Walk in the City of Silk and Traditional-Style Storehouses" are organized by sponsors.

As Suzaka City is known for walking, events such as ''JR East Hiking from the Station'' and "Shinshu Suzaka: A Two-Day Walk in the City of Silk and Traditional-Style Storehouses" are organized by sponsors.
